macros.name: TIMESTAMP
macros.description:
The date and time at which the URI using this macro is accessed. Used wherever a time stamp is needed, the macro is replaced with the date and time using the formatting conventions of ISO 8601.
To add milliseconds, use the convention .mmm at the end of the time provided and before any time zone indicator.
macros.descriptionformatted:
The date and time at which the URI using this macro is accessed. Used wherever a time stamp is needed, the macro is replaced with the date and time using the formatting conventions of ISO 8601.

To add milliseconds, use the convention .mmm at the end of the time provided and before any time zone indicator.
macros.example:
January 17, 2016 at 8:15:07 and 127 milliseconds, Eastern Time would be formatted as follows:
Unencoded: 2016-01-17T8:15:07.127-05
Encoded: 2016-01-17T8%3A15%3A07.127-05

macros.name: CACHEBUSTING
macros.description: Random 8-digit integer.
macros.descriptionformatted: Random 8-digit integer.

macros.name: CONTENTPLAYHEAD
macros.support: Deprecated in VAST 4.1, replaced by [ADPLAYHEAD] and [MEDIAPLAYHEAD]
macros.description: The current time offset of the video or audio content.
macros.descriptionformatted: The current time offset of the video or audio content.

macros.name: MEDIAPLAYHEAD
macros.description:
Playhead position of the video or audio content (NOT the ad creative). 
Not relevant for out-stream ads.
macros.descriptionformatted: Playhead position of the video or audio content (NOT the ad creative). Not relevant for out-stream ads.

macros.name: BREAKPOSITION
macros.description: Indicates the position of the ad break within the underlying video/audio content that the ad is playing within.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the position of the ad break within the underlying video/audio content that the ad is playing in.

macros.name: BLOCKEDADCATEGORIES
macros.description:
List of blocked ad categories. Encoded with IABN-N values as specified in the "Content Categories" list of AdCOM 1.0.
Values must be taken from the BlockedCategory element (3.19.2) in Wrapper ad elements.
macros.descriptionformatted:
List of blocked ad categories. Encoded with IABN-N values as specified in the "Content Categories" list of AdCOM 1.0.
Values must be taken from the BlockedCategory element (3.19.2) in Wrapper ad elements.

macros.name: ADCATEGORIES
macros.description: List of desired ad categories. Encoded with IABN-N values as specified in the "Content Categories" list of AdCOM 1.0.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of desired ad categories. Encoded with IABN-N values as specified in the "Content Categories" list of AdCOM 1.0.

macros.name: ADCOUNT
macros.description:
For VAST requests: the number of ads expected by the player
For tracking pixels: the number of <InLine> ads played within the current chain or tree of VASTs, including the executing one. That is, this value starts at 1 and increments for each video played, whether it was pulled from a Pod, buffet, nested Pod, etc. In standard non-Pod VAST responses with a single <InLine> ad, this value is always 1.
macros.descriptionformatted:
For VAST requests: the number of ads expected by the player

For tracking pixels: the number of ads played within the current chain or tree of VASTs, including the executing one. That is, this value starts at 1 and increments for each video played, whether it was pulled from a Pod, buffet, nested Pod, etc. In standard non-Pod VAST responses with a single ad, this value is always 1.

macros.name: TRANSACTIONID
macros.description: An identifier used to correlate a chain of ad requests from the origination (supply) end. This ID is generated by the initiating player and subsequent ad requests along the chain must pass the same ID along. This ID must be a UUID. Note that this is unique to the initial request, even if there are multiple ads in the response, as in VMAP and VAST Ad Pod cases.
macros.descriptionformatted: An identifier used to correlate a chain of ad requests from the origination (supply) end. This ID is generated by the initiating player and subsequent ad requests along the chain must pass the same ID along. This ID must be a UUID. Note that this is unique to the initial request, even if there are multiple ads in the response, as in VMAP and VAST Ad Pod cases.

macros.name: PLACEMENTTYPE
macros.description: Indicates the type of ad placement. Refer to the Placement Subtypes - Video list in AdCOM.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the type of ad placement. Refer to the Placement Subtypes - Video list in AdCOM.

macros.name: ADTYPE
macros.description: Indicates whether the ad’s intended use case was video, audio, or hybrid, as defined in the adType attribute of the VAST <Ad> element.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates whether the ad’s intended use case was video, audio, or hybrid, as defined in the adType attribute of the VAST element.

macros.name: UNIVERSALADID
macros.description:
Indicates the creative, using UniversalAdId values described in section 3.7.1.
Format: registryID idvalue - with a space separating registryID and value.
Multiple UniversalAdIds can be supported with a comma-separating them.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the creative, using UniversalAdId values described in section 3.7.1.

macros.name: BREAKMAXDURATION
macros.description: Indicates the maximum length allowed for the ad break in seconds.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the maximum length allowed for the ad break in seconds.
macros.example: 30 - 30 seconds max total length allowed in the break.

macros.name: BREAKMAXADS
macros.description: Indicates the maximum number of ads allowed in the ad break.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the maximum number of ads allowed in the ad break.
macros.example: 2 - two ads max in the break.

macros.name: BREAKMINADLENGTH
macros.description: Indicates the minimum length allowed for any individual ad in the ad break in seconds.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the minimum length allowed for any individual ad in the ad break in seconds.
macros.example: 5 - five seconds is the min duration of any ad allowed in the break.

macros.name: BREAKMAXADLENGTH
macros.description: Indicates the maximum length allowed for any individual ad in the ad break in seconds.
macros.descriptionformatted: Indicates the maximum length allowed for any individual ad in the ad break in seconds.
macros.example: 15 - fifteen seconds is the maximum duration of any ad allowed in the break.

macros.name: IFA
macros.description: A resettable advertising ID from a device-specific advertising ID scheme, such as Apple’s ID for Advertisers or Android’s Advertising ID in UUID format or based on the IAB Tech Lab’s Guidelines for IFA on OTT platforms.
macros.descriptionformatted: A resettable advertising ID from a device-specific advertising ID scheme, such as Apple’s ID for Advertisers or Android’s Advertising ID in UUID format or based on the IAB Tech Lab’s Guidelines for IFA on OTT platforms.

macros.name: IFATYPE
macros.description: String value indicating the type of IFA included in the [IFA] macro. More details in the IAB Tech Lab’s Guidelines for IFA on OTT platforms.
macros.descriptionformatted: String value indicating the type of IFA included in the [IFA] macro. More details in the IAB Tech Lab’s Guidelines for IFA on OTT platforms.

macros.name: CLIENTUA
macros.description:
An identifier of the player and VAST client used. This will allow creative providers to identify the client code used to process and render video creatives.
If player name is not available, use "unknown".
macros.descriptionformatted:
An identifier of the player and VAST client used. This will allow creative providers to identify the client code used to process and render video creatives.
If player name is not available, use "unknown".

macros.name: SERVERUA
macros.description:
User-Agent of the server making the request on behalf of a client.
Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.

The goal is to allow ad servers to identify who is making the request, so don’t use generic HTTP server names like Apache, but rather identify the company and product or service making the request.
macros.descriptionformatted:
User-Agent of the server making the request on behalf of a client.

Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.

The goal is to allow ad servers to identify who is making the request, so don’t use generic HTTP server names like Apache, but rather identify the company and product or service making the request.

macros.name: DEVICEUA
macros.description:
User-Agent of the device that is rendering the ad to the end user.
Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.
macros.descriptionformatted:
User-Agent of the device that is rendering the ad to the end user.

Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.
macros.example:
Unencoded:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/51.0.2704.103 Safari/537.36
Encoded:Mozilla%2F5.0%20(X11%3B%20Linux%20x86_64)%20AppleWebKit%2F537.36%20(KHTML%2C%20like%20Gecko)%20Chrome%2F51.0.2704.103%20Safari%2F537.36

macros.name: SERVERSIDE
macros.description:
Value indicating if a URL is requested from a client device or a server. This value may be set differently on the request versus tracking URLs, as the request may be made from a server (value of 1 or 2) while tracking URLs may be fired from the client (value of 0).

0 is the default value if macro is missing.
macros.descriptionformatted: Value indicating if a URL is requested from a client device or a server. This value may be set differently on the request versus tracking URLs, as the request may be made from a server (value of 1 or 2) while tracking URLs may be fired from the client (value of 0). 0 is the default value if macro is missing.

macros.name: DEVICEIP
macros.description:
IP address of the device that is rendering the ad to the end user.
Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.
macros.descriptionformatted:
IP address of the device that is rendering the ad to the end user.

Only relevant when another device (server) is making the request on behalf of that client.

macros.name: LATLONG
macros.description: Mobile detected geolocation info of the end user; latitude and longitude separated by a coma.
macros.descriptionformatted: Mobile detected geolocation info of the end user; latitude and longitude separated by a coma.

macros.name: DOMAIN
macros.description: Domain of the top level page where the end user will view the ad.
macros.descriptionformatted: Domain of the top level page where the end user will view the ad.

macros.name: PAGEURL
macros.support: Required if OM for Web is supported, otherwise Optional.
macros.description: The full URL of the top level page where the end user will view the ad. Where required and applicable, but unknown or unavailable, -1 or -2 must be set, as described in 6.1. When required and not applicable (such as in an app), 0 must be set.
macros.descriptionformatted: The full URL of the top level page where the end user will view the ad. Where required and applicable, but unknown or unavailable, -1 or -2 must be set, as described in 6.1. When required and not applicable (such as in an app), 0 must be set.

macros.name: APPBUNDLE
macros.support: Required if OM for App is supported, otherwise Optional.
macros.description: For app ads, a platform-specific application identifier, bundle or package name and should not be an app store ID such as iTunes store ID. Where required and applicable, but unknown or unavailable, -1 or -2 must be set, as described in 6.1. When required and not applicable (such as in an app), 0 must be set.
macros.descriptionformatted: For app ads, a platform-specific application identifier, bundle or package name and should not be an app store ID such as iTunes store ID. Where required and applicable, but unknown or unavailable, -1 or -2 must be set, as described in 6.1. When required and not applicable (such as in an app), 0 must be set.

macros.name: VASTVERSIONS
macros.description:
List of VAST versions supported by the player. Values are defined in the AdCOM 1.0 "Creative Subtypes" list. The relevant IDs have been copied here for convenience.
11 for VAST 4.1
12 for VAST 4.1 Wrapper
macros.descriptionformatted:
List of VAST versions supported by the player. Values are defined in the AdCOM 1.0 "Creative Subtypes" list. The relevant IDs have been copied here for convenience.

11 for VAST 4.1
12 for VAST 4.1 Wrapper

macros.name: APIFRAMEWORKS
macros.description: ist of frameworks supported by the player. Values are defined in the AdCOM 1.0 "API Frameworks" list.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of frameworks supported by the player. Values are defined in the AdCOM 1.0 "API Frameworks" list.

macros.name: EXTENSIONS
macros.description: List of VAST Extensions type attribute values that the player / client supports. Can be used to indicate support for the OMID AdVerifications extension, proprietary extensions, or future standardized extensions.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of VAST Extensions type attribute values that the player / client supports. Can be used to indicate support for the OMID AdVerifications extension, proprietary extensions, or future standardized extensions.

macros.name: VERIFICATIONVENDORS
macros.description: List of VAST Verification vendor attribute values that the player / client supports.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of VAST Verification vendor attribute values that the player / client supports.

macros.name: OMIDPARTNER
macros.description:
An identifier of the OM SDK integration. This is the same as the “name” and “versionString” parameters of the OMID Partner object. This will allow creative providers to determine if the OM partner integration is acceptable.
Note - This value is essential for communicating the certification status of the OMID integration. If partner ID is not shared, verification vendors will not be able to properly measure and report on this inventory.

If partner name is not available, use “unknown”.
macros.descriptionformatted:
An identifier of the OM SDK integration. This is the same as the “name” and “versionString” parameters of the OMID Partner object. This will allow creative providers to determine if the OM partner integration is acceptable.

Note - This value is essential for communicating the certification status of the OMID integration. If partner ID is not shared, verification vendors will not be able to properly measure and report on this inventory.

If partner name is not available, use “unknown”.

macros.name: MEDIAMIME
macros.description: List of media MIME types supported by the player.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of media MIME types supported by the player.

macros.name: PLAYERCAPABILITIES
macros.description: List of values that describe the player capabilities.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of values that describe the player capabilities.

macros.name: CLICKTYPE
macros.description:
Indicates the type of clickthrough supported by the player.
3 supersedes 2 in the case that there are both a link and a confirmation dialog.
macros.descriptionformatted:
Indicates the type of clickthrough supported by the player.

3 supersedes 2 in the case that there are both a link and a confirmation dialog.

macros.name: PLAYERSTATE
macros.description: List of options indicating the current player state.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of options indicating the current player state.

macros.name: INVENTORYSTATE
macros.description: List of options indicating attributes of the inventory.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of options indicating attributes of the inventory.

macros.name: PLAYERSIZE
macros.description: Integer width and height of the player, separated by a coma, measured in pixels (device-independent).
macros.descriptionformatted: Integer width and height of the player, separated by a coma, measured in pixels (device-independent).

macros.name: ADPLAYHEAD
macros.description: Media playhead position.
macros.descriptionformatted: Media playhead position.

macros.name: ASSETURI
macros.description: The URI of the ad asset currently being played.
macros.descriptionformatted: The URI of the ad asset currently being played.

macros.name: CONTENTID
macros.description:
The publisher-specific content identifier for the content asset into which the ad is being loaded or inserted. Only applicable to in-stream ads.
The format of this field is similar to the [UNIVERSALADID] macro, consisting of a registry identifier and a registry-specific content identifier. If you are not using a public registry, you can use your own domain name as the registry identifier.

If this macro is provided, the provided content identifier should uniquely define a specific content asset.
macros.descriptionformatted:
The publisher-specific content identifier for the content asset into which the ad is being loaded or inserted. Only applicable to in-stream ads.

The format of this field is similar to the [UNIVERSALADID] macro, consisting of a registry identifier and a registry-specific content identifier. If you are not using a public registry, you can use your own domain name as the registry identifier.

If this macro is provided, the provided content identifier should uniquely define a specific content asset.

macros.name: CONTENTURI
macros.description: The URI of the main media content asset into which the ad is being loaded or inserted. Only applicable to in-stream ads.
macros.descriptionformatted: The URI of the main media content asset into which the ad is being loaded or inserted. Only applicable to in-stream ads.

macros.name: PODSEQUENCE
macros.description: The value of the sequence attribute on the <Ad> that is currently playing, if one is provided.
macros.descriptionformatted: The value of the sequence attribute on the that is currently playing, if one is provided.

macros.name: ADSERVINGID
macros.description: The value of the <AdServingId> for the currently playing ad, as passed from the ad server.
macros.descriptionformatted: The value of the for the currently playing ad, as passed from the ad server.

macros.name: CLICKPOS
macros.description: Coordinates of the click relative to the area defined by the [PLAYERSIZE] macro, measured in css (device-independent) pixels.
macros.descriptionformatted: Coordinates of the click relative to the area defined by the [PLAYERSIZE] macro, measured in css (device-independent) pixels.

macros.name: ERRORCODE
macros.description: VAST Error Code. Replaced with one of the error codes listed in section 2.3.6.3 when the associated error occurs; reserved for error tracking URIs.
macros.descriptionformatted: VAST Error Code. Replaced with one of the error codes listed in section 2.3.6.3 when the associated error occurs; reserved for error tracking URIs.

macros.name: REASON
macros.description: Reason code for not executing verification.
macros.descriptionformatted: Reason code for not executing verification.

macros.name: LIMITADTRACKING
macros.description: The limit ad tracking setting of a device-specific advertising ID scheme. This value is a boolean, with “1” indicating that a user has opted for limited ad tracking, and “0” indicating that the user has not opted.
macros.descriptionformatted: The limit ad tracking setting of a device-specific advertising ID scheme. This value is a boolean, with 1 indicating that a user has opted for limited ad tracking, and 0 indicating that the user has not opted.

macros.name: REGULATIONS
macros.description: List of applicable regulations.
macros.descriptionformatted: List of applicable regulations.

macros.name: GDPRCONSENT
macros.description: Base64-encoded Cookie Value of IAB GDPR consent info.
macros.descriptionformatted: Cookie Value of IAB GDPR consent info.

macros.name: STOREID
macros.description: For app ads, a platform-specific app store ID such as iTunes store ID. Could be the same as app bundle on some platforms.
macros.descriptionformatted: For app ads, a platform-specific app store ID such as iTunes store ID. Could be the same as app bundle on some platforms. This macro belongs in the 'Publisher Info' section longer term.

macros.name: STOREURL
macros.description: For app ads, the app store URL for the installed app.
macros.descriptionformatted: For app ads, the app store URL for the installed app. This macro belongs in the 'Publisher Info' section longer term.

INVENTORYSTATE_values.description: to indicate the ad can be skipped
to indicate the ad is autoplayed with audio unmuted
to indicate the ad is autoplayed with audio muted
to indicate the user takes an explicit action to knowingly start playback of the ad

PLAYERSTATE_values.description: to indicate the player is currently muted
to indicate the player is currently fullscreen

CLICKTYPE_values.description: clickable on full area of video
clickable only on associated button or link

PLAYERCAPABILITIES_values.description: to indicate the user's ability to skip the ad
to indicate the user's ability to mute/unmute audio
to indicate the player's ability to autoplay media with audio; also implies mautoplay
to indicate the player's ability to autoplay media when muted
to indicate the user's ability to enter fullscreen
to indicate the player's ability to render NAI icons from VAST

SERVERSIDE_values.description: Client fires request or tracking call without server intermediary
Server fires request or tracking call on behalf of a client. The client told the server to act on its behalf
Server fires request or tracking call on behalf of another server, unknown party, or based on its own decision, without an explicit signal from the client
